item.title: Systemd
item.description: Monstache has support built in for integrating with systemd. The following monstache.service is an example systemd configuration. [Unit] Description=monstache sync service [Service] Type=notify ExecStart=/usr/local/bin/monstache WatchdogSec=30s Restart=on-failure [Install] WantedBy=multi-user.target System-d unit files are normally saved to /lib/systemd/system. After saving the monstache.service file you can run systemctl daemon-reload to tell systemd to reload all unit files. You can enable the service to start on boot with systemctl enable monstache.service and start the service with systemctl start monstache.
